title: Warsongs Album COPYRIGHT STRIKE

embed.description: Warsongs is an anthology of 11 classic League tunes remixed and amped up for your competitive climb. Download the album here: http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/site/warsongs/ You can check out Minnesota here: Website: http://www.minnmusic.com Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/DJMinnesota Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/minnesotabass Soundcloud: http://www.soundcloud.com/minnesota Instagram: @minnesotabass

body:
I used this song in one of my League videos, and [Merlin] Label Engine made a copyright claim! All the other songs gave me no problem, why this one? Is this some fraude stealing the rights of the song? Did Riot sell the rights to this company? I really doubt it.

They are monetising a song which they have no claim to it. You're Song video should have been stricked as well, so any word on this matter?

replies.body: Not my particular area of expertise, but I'll reach out about it.  To help this along, can you give me a link to where you posted your video?

> [{quoted}](name=RiotBok,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=VPiU9OkN,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-06-01T22:08:00.896+0000)
>
> Not my particular area of expertise, but I'll reach out about it.  To help this along, can you give me a link to where you posted your video?


https://youtu.be/wv5IyeJRJ88

here's the link, I only used league songs, Warsongs/The Music of League of Legends Volume 1. The Copyright claim is the song at 35:22 - 39:12 Edge of Infinity (Minnesota Remix) - Minnesota 


**content **
Edge of Infinity (Minnesota Remix) - Minnesota 
Sound recording 
35:22 - 39:12 play match 

**claimant **
 [Merlin] Label Engine 
On behalf of: Minnesota

**policy **
 Monetised by copyright owner 
  Remove song  


I filed a dispute, saying that it's a free album made by Riot Games and that's in public domain and copyright free. Linked the Warsongs webpage, and I got this message today:

"After reviewing your dispute, [Merlin] Label Engine has decided that their copyright claim is still valid. 

Video title: My Epic 4v5 Placements Game 
Copyrighted song: Edge of Infinity (Minnesota Remix) 
 Claimed by: [Merlin] Label Engine "


Someone copryrighted a free song and now the youtube's content ID is giving them all the monetization. Isn't this like a really serious scam?

Hi there!

I'm Everyone's Favorite YouTube Guy (tm), and based on your song usage it looks like this is an incorrect takedown. As our FAQ states you can use League music for videos so long as it isn't a straight repost and it _should_ be fine. For some reason this isn't, so I'll get in touch with my YouTube contacts and see if we can't sort it out. Thanks for bringing this to our attention! As you probably know clearing these things can take a while, but since this takedown looks like it's been automated from a third party I doubt it will be too much of an issue (stuff like this happens all the time. Family Guy, anyone?).

On the subject of this, does RIOT have any kind of stances on debates like #WherestheFairUse and the other issues with youtube takedowns? I would think since this "Merlin Label Engine" is basically stealing stuff you guys made for fans, it's would stick in some craws?

I can't speak for the company at large, but I can **offer my own opinion** as a [YouTuber](https://www.youtube.com/user/HotPepperGaming) and Internet Person. 

PERSONAL OPINION FOLLOWS:

I dislike the current automated system of copyright claims and think that such an aggressive takedown stance hurts both the creator community and the products firing off crazy DCMA claims, but sadly the alternative (watching every piece of content piece by piece) is much too daunting a task for even the largest corporation to handle effectively. Until there are better automated scraping tools I feel like this is just what we have to deal with for the foreseeable future, and that, quite frankly, sucks.

YouTube could do a better job nuking copyright claim trolls, though. Those guys are highly visible and highly horrible.

> [{quoted}](name=Carnival Knights,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=VPiU9OkN,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-06-03T00:06:44.811+0000)
>
> Hi there!
> 
> I'm Everyone's Favorite YouTube Guy (tm), and based on your song usage it looks like this is an incorrect takedown. As our FAQ states you can use League music for videos so long as it isn't a straight repost and it _should_ be fine. For some reason this isn't, so I'll get in touch with my YouTube contacts and see if we can't sort it out. Thanks for bringing this to our attention! As you probably know clearing these things can take a while, but since this takedown looks like it's been automated from a third party I doubt it will be too much of an issue (stuff like this happens all the time. Family Guy, anyone?).

Thank you so much. It isn't a takedown notice, they are just controlling the revenue of the video, which is kind of unfair to know that some scammer is getting all the monetization of you work just because he registered a free song. 

I checked that Label Midia, and it's some sort of independent label where you upload your music and they take care of the copyrights. So in before someone decides to register ALL League's songs as his, what can we do?
We're actively working with YT as we speak. This particular company looks like DCMA trolls - an annoying aspect of an annoying system - so hopefully it won't happen again after precedent is set.

So should I "Appeal Rejected Dispute" or just wait for it to go away? This system is so stupid, there's no one with a brain in between, this dispute goes directly to the company claiming the rights, and then it's up to them to release the claim or not, and since they are scammers, they will just decline again a set my account in bad standards.  This is so frustrating...
Continue to appeal for now. Hopefully this can be solved by the end of the week!
Thank you so much! ^^ all claims were released now!
Awesome! Good to hear. Our music should be whitelisted now, but if you get hit with another copyright claim please feel free to reach out to myself or creator support!
They attacked again in an older video, same song though.  :/
Oh, for sure. They claimed an old video of mine years ago for the background music in Ecco the Dolphin. Which, as we all know, is represented by Merlin the Copyright Wizard.
